paper_abstract: We show that if pn >> log n the binomial random graph Gn,p has an approximate Hamilton decomposition. More precisely, we show that in this range Gn,p contains a set of edge-disjoint Hamilton cycles covering almost all of its edges. This is best possible in the sense that the condition that pn >> log n is necessary. (c) 2011 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 2012
paper_title: Approximate Hamilton decompositions of random graphs
